channel.title: Black Girls Heal
channel.itunes:subtitle: Healing the Effects of Love Addiction, Love Avoidance, and Unresolved Childhood Trauma
channel.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
channel.itunes:summary:
Black Girls Heal helps women break out of cycles of unhealthy relationships with unavailable partners and feeling not enough by combining coaching, therapeutic support, and practical tools.
Every episode, we will talk about intimacy, attachment, healing unresolved trauma, and growing in our self worth.
channel.description:
Black Girls Heal helps women break out of cycles of unhealthy relationships with unavailable partners and feeling not enough by combining coaching, therapeutic support, and practical tools.
Every episode, we will talk about intimacy, attachment, healing unresolved trauma, and growing in our self worth.

item.itunes:title: #162: Dealing with Seasons of Conflict
item.title: #162: Dealing with Seasons of Conflict
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.description:
In today’s episode, we’re talking about how to deal when you are in a season of conflict. Whether it be with people from your past or in the present, my hope is that the 4 things I share in this episode will support you navigate this season.


CONNECT WITH US ELSEWHERE

item.itunes:title: #160: The No Contact Process as a Healing Tool for Love Addiction
item.title: #160: The No Contact Process as a Healing Tool for Love Addiction
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.description:
Let's talk about using a 90 day no contact period as a reset tool to help you gain clarity.


We talk about the why and the process within inside.

item.itunes:title: $159: Don't Text Them (Sit on Your F'ing Hands)
item.title: $159: Don't Text Them (Sit on Your F'ing Hands)
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.description:
In this episode, we're talking to anyone who is currently in a love addictive cycle and needs to pull back to reset and regain their sense of self.

This is not a full no contact episode, but just a challenge to pull back and not initiate for week to gain some clarity.

item.itunes:title: Bonus Episode: October Catch Up with Shena
item.title: Bonus Episode: October Catch Up with Shena
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.description:
In this bonus episode, you can catch up with me about the things I am personally learning and applying in my life for pleasure, fun and healing that I'd like to share. A tiny bit of tea is spilled, and though impromptu lessons may happen, this is not a full teaching episode.

Feel free to stay and listen if you'd like to learn more about me or binge our archive. Either way, we hope you enjoy!


Things Mentioned:

Astro.com

Cosmic Vibrations (the TikTok astrocartographers I follow)

Book: The Art of Receiving and Giving by Dr. Betty Martin

item.itunes:title: #157: Making Running the Household Fair with Laura Danger
item.title: #157: Making Running the Household Fair with Laura Danger
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.description:
What happens when running the household feels imbalanced, unfair, and it's causing discord with you and your partner?

In this episode, Laura Danger joins us to talk about the tool of the Fair Play Method and how to implement it into your relationship.

item.itunes:title: #155: Setting Unrealistic Expectations Based on Fantasy
item.title: #155: Setting Unrealistic Expectations Based on Fantasy
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.description:
Can we "break our own heart" by creating unrealistic expectations for others based on our fantasies of who we want them to be?

Let's talk about it in today's episode.

MENTIONED IN THIS EPISODE:

  • Share your story with us about being or feeling like a "married single mother": blackgirlsheal.org/speak

item.itunes:title: #151: Grieving Being Let Down at Your Big Events
item.title: #151: Grieving Being Let Down at Your Big Events
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: Sometimes family and loved ones don't rise to the occassion and show up for us as we need them to at our big events (i.e. weddings, graduations, birthday parties, child births, etc). This abandonment is a real form of trauma. In this episode, I...
item.itunes:summary:
Sometimes family and loved ones don't rise to the occassion and show up for us as we need them to at our big events (i.e. weddings, graduations, birthday parties, child births, etc). This abandonment is a real form of trauma.

In this episode, I discuss what to do to emotionally prepare yourself if you have an event coming that you fear you may be disappointed and also coping  with your feelings if something hurtful has happened before.

 

Click here to Register for Our Open House on Tuesday, August 30th at 6:30pm CST


CONNECT WITH US ELSEWHERE

item.itunes:title: #150: Feeling Whatever You Need to Feel About Your Past Relationship
item.title: #150: Feeling Whatever You Need to Feel About Your Past Relationship
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: When relationships do not work out (Friendship, romantic, familial, or otherwise) we can have a variety of emotional responses: neutrality, intense longing and love, hatred and rage, and any combination in between. In this episode, we talk about how...
item.itunes:summary:
When relationships do not work out (Friendship, romantic, familial, or otherwise) we can have a variety of emotional responses: neutrality, intense longing and love, hatred and rage, and any combination in between.

In this episode, we talk about how you are allowed to have whatever emotions you need to have about this relationship in this season.

 

Register for our Recovery School Open House - Click here to Save your Seat

item.itunes:title: #144: How to Let Your Partner Have Their Own Feelings
item.title: #144: How to Let Your Partner Have Their Own Feelings
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: Your partner is their own person with their own feelings. But sometimes those feelings can be triggering to us even when they don't intend it to be. In this episode, we go over 3 things to keep in mind to help you allow your partner to have their own...
item.itunes:summary:
Your partner is their own person with their own feelings. But sometimes those feelings can be triggering to us even when they don't intend it to be.

In this episode, we go over 3 things to keep in mind to help you allow your partner to have their own emotional experience. 

 

Ready to let your loved ones in or provide space for those who want to love you? Check out the Let Them Love You Workshop to gain skills and make love easier.

Register for the Let Them Love You Workshop

item.itunes:title: #140: Your Trauma and Your (Conflictual) Relationship w/ Your Daughter
item.title: #140: Your Trauma and Your (Conflictual) Relationship w/ Your Daughter
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: If you're a mom and have a conflictual relationship with your daughter, part of it *might* be because your unresolved inner child wounds that resurface when faced with a part of yourself you have not embraced. In this episode we're going to talk about...
item.itunes:summary:
If you're a mom and have a conflictual relationship with your daughter, part of it *might* be because your unresolved inner child wounds that resurface when faced with a part of yourself you have not embraced.

In this episode we're going to talk about what it may look like along with 9 steps for you to take to work through this.

 

Click here to Join You Are Worthy

Click here to Join The Loved Woman Foundations

item.itunes:title: #128: God is not calling you to be abused
item.title: #128: God is not calling you to be abused
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: God is not calling you to be abused in your relationship. Period. In this episode, we are talking about domestic violence, why it is NOT the same of other typical couple conflict, and support for Christian women who may feel conflicted with leaving....
item.itunes:summary:
God is not calling you to be abused in your relationship.

Period.

In this episode, we are talking about domestic violence, why it is NOT the same of other typical couple conflict, and support for Christian women who may feel conflicted with leaving.

Note: Though this episode pulls from Christian teaching, the message is for everyone who needs it.

Domestic Violence Hotline (call, chat, or text for free 24/7)

The National Center Against Domestic Violence

RESOURCES

  • Join our weekly text inspiration list by texting PODCAST to 832-219-7815
  • Apply to work together in From Avoidant to Available
  • Create balance and love in your life with The Loved Woman Planner

item.itunes:title: #127: Internalized Misogyny & Love Addiction
item.title: #127: Internalized Misogyny & Love Addiction
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: In a current social trend that is pushing misogyny at length as self help, in this episode, we're looking at some common examples of internalized misogyny love addicts and codependents may face due to trauma, examples of alternative mindsets, and...
item.itunes:summary:
In a current social trend that is pushing misogyny at length as self help, in this episode, we're looking at some common examples of internalized misogyny love addicts and codependents may face due to trauma, examples of alternative mindsets, and encouragement to be kind with oneself and self-forgive while unlearning these patterns.

 

RESOURCES MENTIONED

  • Join our weekly text inspiration list by texting PODCAST to 832-219-7815

In a current social trend that is pushing misogyny at length as self help, in this episode, we're looking at some common examples of internalized misogyny love addicts and codependents may face due to trauma, examples of alternative mindsets, and encouragement to be kind with oneself and self-forgive while unlearning these patterns.

 

RESOURCES MENTIONED

  • Join our weekly text inspiration list by texting PODCAST to 832-219-7815

item.itunes:title: #112: What to Keep in Mind When You Miss Red Flags
item.title: #112: What to Keep in Mind When You Miss Red Flags
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: If you’ve missed red flags in a relationship, it’s completely and totally okay. There is no shame in having missed the signs and suddenly realizing that they are there. Which is why I’m sharing what to keep in mind when you miss red flags. ...
item.itunes:summary:
If you’ve missed red flags in a relationship, it’s completely and totally okay. There is no shame in having missed the signs and suddenly realizing that they are there. Which is why I’m sharing what to keep in mind when you miss red flags. 

Lately, I’ve seen a lot of chatter about women starting to heal and then suddenly seeing the signs of a bad relationship that they’d previously missed. For so many women this noticing leads to feelings of shame and guilt that they didn’t recognize the signs sooner. 

Stop right there. 

Instead of heading down the shame spiral, take a moment and be kind to yourself. So you didn’t recognize those signs right off. You do now and that’s what’s important. Be kind, compassionate, and loving to yourself so that you can finally break the cycle. 

I also want you to know that there is nothing wrong with you. You are not what is broken. Even if you’ve chosen the same type of relationship over and over again, it’s not your fault that you’re being mistreated. 

Lastly, no matter how long you’ve been in the relationship or where you’re at in life, you have the right to choose how to respond. It doesn’t matter if you’re 10 minutes, 10 days, or 10 years into it, you can change your future by making a new choice. 

You’re on the path to healing and growth because you see the red flags. What choice will you make now that you know? 

In this episode: 

  • [00:35] Welcome back loved ones!
  • [02:22] Have you ever felt regret or shame for missing red flags in relationships? 
  • [03:22] When you do notice those red flags, be kind, compassionate, and loving to yourself. 
  • [04:26] Do you know what being kind to yourself means? 
  • [07:28] I want you to do something different than you've ever done before. 
  • [09:36] There is nothing wrong with you.
  • [13:06] Don’t mistake self-accountability and taking ownership with self-deprecation.
  • [13:38] No matter where you are or how long things have been happening, you get to choose how to respond. 
  • [15:27] As soon as you decide that you’re ready to get out, that’s all you need.

Links & Resources: 

RESOURCES MENTIONED

  • Join our weekly text inspiration list by texting PODCAST to 832-219-7815
  • Get our free download - The 5 Step Roadmap to Heal Love Addiction
  • Apply to work together in From Avoidant to Available
  • Learn that YOU ARE WORTHY - Enroll in You Are Worthy here
  • Create balance and love in your life with The Loved Woman Planner

  • Facebook: Black Girls Heal
  • Website: Blackgirlsheal.org

item.itunes:title: #111: 3 Ways to Know You’ve Grown and are Healthier
item.title: #111: 3 Ways to Know You’ve Grown and are Healthier
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: It’s time to give yourself a pat on the back. One of the things we as women, but especially Black women, don’t do often enough is recognize when we’ve made progress. This is why I’m sharing three ways to know that you’ve grown and are...
item.itunes:summary:
It’s time to give yourself a pat on the back. One of the things we as women, but especially Black women, don’t do often enough is recognize when we’ve made progress. This is why I’m sharing three ways to know that you’ve grown and are healthier. 

The reason I decided it was time for this type of episode was because of a conversation I had with one of my coaching students. We were talking about some things going on in her life and she kept prefacing her comments with, “I’m love avoidant…” or “I’m trying to be less love avoidant…” 

As she was talking I had to stop her and point out that she isn’t love avoidant anymore. She’d made huge progress and was actually approaching various situations in completely new ways and had really stepped away from being love avoidant. 

The problem was, she couldn’t see it. She didn’t recognize her growth for what it was and continued to see herself as the person she was when she first started her work. 

Which is why you need to do the work, but then recognize it when you’ve grown. If you’ve started pausing before you react, been more open to alternative viewpoints, and have started feeling your emotions, then you’ve grown. 

Listen in to hear more and then take a moment to celebrate your growth and give yourself a pat on the back. Even if you’ve only fully stepped into one of these areas, you are on the path to healing and you need to celebrate your milestones. I’m giving you that permission right now! 

In this episode: 

  • [00:51] It’s so important to give yourself credit and recognize that you’ve grown. Learn why!
  • [01:27] Why I’m sharing this topic. 
  • [04:54] Learn three signs that you have grown and get ready to celebrate them.
  • [06:06] Do you pause before you react? Then you’ve grown!
  • [08:41] Have you been more open to seeing alternative viewpoints in a conversation? 
  • [11:39] Asking questions and being curious is very helpful in relationships. 
  • [13:19] You have a choice when you ask the phrase, “Is that true?” in a conversation. 
  • [16:07] Another alternative is acknowledging when you go into fantasy mode while dating. 
  • [19:41] Choose the meaning you attach to your emotions and feelings. 
  • [20:16] The third sign you’ve grown is that you’re able to feel your emotions and validate them.
  • [22:01] One bonus sign is that you share your emotions with people who are safe. 
  • [25:34] Pat yourself on the back and celebrate your growth. 

Links & Resources: 

RESOURCES MENTIONED

  • Join our weekly text inspiration list by texting PODCAST to 832-219-7815
  • Get our free download - The 5 Step Roadmap to Heal Love Addiction
  • Apply to work together in From Avoidant to Available
  • Learn that YOU ARE WORTHY - Enroll in You Are Worthy here
  • Create balance and love in your life with The Loved Woman Planner

  • Facebook: Black Girls Heal
  • Website: Blackgirlsheal.org

item.itunes:title: #110: 4 Ways to Not be Codependent as a Healer
item.title: #110: 4 Ways to Not be Codependent as a Healer
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: I’m sharing these tips for anyone who is a professional healer. Those of you who are therapists, coaches, crystal workers, healers of all sorts, listen in. But, if you are the sage of your family, perhaps a priest or pastor, or maybe a teacher who...
item.itunes:summary:
I’m sharing these tips for anyone who is a professional healer. Those of you who are therapists, coaches, crystal workers, healers of all sorts, listen in. But, if you are the sage of your family, perhaps a priest or pastor, or maybe a teacher who hears the burdens of your students, then this is for you as well. 

As healers, we need to be sure to avoid codependency. What does that mean exactly? As a whole, it means not making your client or family member or student’s journey about you. You cannot superimpose your issues onto their healing. 

The first way to avoid codependency is by not arguing with people who aren’t ready for transformation. You cannot push people toward healing. They will walk the path toward healing in their own time and you badgering them into it will not make them go any faster. 

When people share their feelings with you, stop, take a moment, and then ask them what they need from you. Rather than listening and then immediately trying to fix the problem, see what they’re looking to gain by confiding in you first. 

Also don’t personalize the other person’s progress. Their wins and losses are not reflective of your involvement in their life. It’s their healing journey, not yours so their progress has nothing to do with you. 

Listen in to hear all four ways plus a little bonus. We all have our own issues to deal with which is why healers also need to have their own healer to go to. Just make sure that you don’t use your relationship with your clients to work on your own baggage. 

In this episode: 

  • [00:34] Being a healer is a privilege in someone’s life no matter if it’s in a personal or professional capacity.

item.description:
I’m sharing these tips for anyone who is a professional healer. Those of you who are therapists, coaches, crystal workers, healers of all sorts, listen in. But, if you are the sage of your family, perhaps a priest or pastor, or maybe a teacher who hears the burdens of your students, then this is for you as well. 

As healers, we need to be sure to avoid codependency. What does that mean exactly? As a whole, it means not making your client or family member or student’s journey about you. You cannot superimpose your issues onto their healing. 

The first way to avoid codependency is by not arguing with people who aren’t ready for transformation. You cannot push people toward healing. They will walk the path toward healing in their own time and you badgering them into it will not make them go any faster. 

When people share their feelings with you, stop, take a moment, and then ask them what they need from you. Rather than listening and then immediately trying to fix the problem, see what they’re looking to gain by confiding in you first. 

Also don’t personalize the other person’s progress. Their wins and losses are not reflective of your involvement in their life. It’s their healing journey, not yours so their progress has nothing to do with you. 

Listen in to hear all four ways plus a little bonus. We all have our own issues to deal with which is why healers also need to have their own healer to go to. Just make sure that you don’t use your relationship with your clients to work on your own baggage. 

In this episode: 

  • [00:34] Being a healer is a privilege in someone’s life no matter if it’s in a personal or professional capacity. 
  • [02:27] If you are a healer, it’s important that you don’t expect more from the relationship than it is.

  • [17:52] Stop over-giving, which is not the same as over-delivering. 
  • [20:12] If you truly believe in this person, then step out of the way. 
  • [22:59] I personally have struggled with over-giving as a coach even though I perfected it as a therapist. 
  • [27:01] No matter how hard someone pushes you, you’ll complete things in your own time and space. The same is true with your clients. 
  • [30:54] Are you talking with your therapist or coach about your own personal triggers? 
  • [32:37] We all have places where we need to learn and grow. 
  • [33:05] Why you need to stay focused on your own life. 
  • [36:14] As a healer you cannot be possessive or jealous. You don’t need to be someone’s everything. 
  • [38:17] Learn how to just say no. Space is okay.
  • [41:26] If you’re a healer, more is not always better. 
  • [43:53] How I’m modeling this. 

Links & Resources: 

The Four Agreements by Don Miguel Ruiz

item.itunes:title: #109: Being Healed and Loved Woman at All Times
item.title: #109: Being Healed and Loved Woman at All Times
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: It’s that time again. It’s time for a refresher on what it means to be a healed and loved woman as developed in our three part framework. Listen in to hear the framework again and what you need to do to move from love addiction, avoidance, or...
item.itunes:summary:
It’s that time again. It’s time for a refresher on what it means to be a healed and loved woman as developed in our three part framework. Listen in to hear the framework again and what you need to do to move from love addiction, avoidance, or anorexia to being a healed and loved woman. 

I’m starting it all off with love addiction. So many women are stuck in a cycle of love addiction and aren’t sure how to get out of it. Oftentimes we think of sex addiction as something separate but it’s really another facet of being addicted to love. It’s just manifested in the physical. 

When you’re love avoidant you’re perfectly happy to just relax and keep yourself away from love. Many times wives and mothers hide love avoidance through the actions of taking care of others, but you still need love. 

Love anorexia is a short-lived stage, but it’s one that is prolonged when you’re not balanced. Love anorexia or love deprivation results in women living in a fantasy world. Usually this disorder is triggered by a bad relationship and then swearing off love, but when you live a balanced life you no longer need dramatic swings. 

Intimacy disorders are complex, but with the right guidance you can leave them behind and live a balanced and fulfilled life. Listen in to hear more. Which of these do you identify with? 

In this episode: 

  • [00:34] Welcome back! Get ready to refresh your knowledge on the Healed & Loved Woman framework. 
  • [03:25] Learn more about the three intimacy disorders that I discuss on this podcast. 
  • [06:37] The signs of being a love addict. 
  • [08:32] Ways sex is used to create a deeper connection but it doesn’t necessarily work. 
  • [11:32] Signs that you may struggle with love avoidance. 
  • [14:45] Personal attributes you may have when you’re love avoidant. 
  • [17:35] Love avoidant women want nothing more than to just relax. 
  • [18:14] Do you have love anorexia? 
  • [21:56] Love deprived ladies will often build lives built on fantasies. 
  • [23:36] How did the term “love anorexia” come about? 
  • [26:57] Join our From Avoidant to Available program.
  • [28:33] The swings that love avoidant and love anorexic women will see in their lives. 
  • [30:57] A ring does nothing for your internal beliefs. Neither does losing weight or other measures.
  • [31:57] What it looks like when you become a healed and loved woman.
  • [33:15] Learn about balance in your relationships. 
  • [35:48] You can like someone without having to be with them. 
  • [37:04] What boundaries really should mean and how they should be presented. 
  • [38:11] The benefits of being love available.
  • [41:59] The traits of a love available woman. 
  • [44:29] What it looks like when you’re living in your love worthiness. 
  • [48:01] When you are active in your love worthiness you show up for opportunities to find love.

Links & Resources: 

RESOURCES MENTIONED

  • Join our weekly text inspiration list by texting PODCAST to 832-219-7815
  • Get our free download - The 5 Step Roadmap to Heal Love Addiction
  • Apply to work together in From Avoidant to Available
  • Learn that YOU ARE WORTHY - Enroll in You Are Worthy here
  • Create balance and love in your life with The Loved Woman Planner
  • CONNECT WITH US ELSEWHERE
    • Instagram: @BlackGirlsHeal
    • Facebook: Black Girls Heal
    • Website: Blackgirlsheal.org
Advertising Inquiries: https://redcircle.com/brands Privacy & Opt-Out: https://redcircle.com/privacy

item.itunes:title: #108: How to Make Adult Female Friendships with Danielle Bayard Jackson
item.title: #108: How to Make Adult Female Friendships with Danielle Bayard Jackson
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: Why is it so difficult for some women to find and maintain healthy female friendships? Joining me today is Danielle Bayard Jackson, The Friendship Expert, to share more about this topic and to help provide actionable advice to get your friendships...
item.itunes:summary:
Why is it so difficult for some women to find and maintain healthy female friendships? Joining me today is Danielle Bayard Jackson, The Friendship Expert, to share more about this topic and to help provide actionable advice to get your friendships back on track, even if they’ve fallen off due to the pandemic. 

Danielle is a publicist by day and a certified friendship coach by night. She started her career as a high school English teacher for many years and was relied upon by her students to help navigate friendship issues. 

What she didn’t realize is that those “high school dramas” weren’t limited to high school. So often the way we approach friendship and relationships in general at a young age, follows us throughout our lives and experiences. 

Friendship like any other relationship requires work and nurturing but after more than a year of limited in-person interaction, it may seem daunting to reconnect. 

Listen as Danielle shares her tips for re-emerging as we reach the end of this pandemic and what you can be doing right now to start working on building new friendships. Remember that there could be people in your existing circle that you’d click with, you just need to give it a chance. 

Also, just because someone doesn’t have the capacity to spend time with you right now does not mean that they aren’t interested in friendship. Don’t let the stories you tell yourself obscure what could be an amazing relationship. 

If you’ve struggled in any way with finding strong female friendships, then you won’t want to miss out on everything Danielle has to share.

In this episode: 

  • [01:01] Welcome friendship coach and expert Danielle Bayard Jackson to chat all about making and maintaining adult female friendships.
  • [04:22] Listen as Danielle shares more about her background and business. 
  • [05:24] How did she become a friendship coach? 
  • [07:10] Why is it so difficult for us to keep and maintain female friendships in adulthood. 
  • [09:14] Danielle shares how she defines and describes a healthy friendship. 
  • [13:31] Ways to deal with the waiting period between finding new acquaintances and making new friends. 
  • [15:43] There is a study that has attempted to quantify how long it takes to build a friendship.
  • [18:03] What to do when you realize that you don’t feel like you have the energy for friendships. 
  • [23:42] Is there a right and wrong to determine how many coins we have available to give?
  • [27:03] The special thing about woman-to-woman friendships. 
  • [30:47] Learn the single greatest determining factor of our overall well-being. 
  • [32:37] What is your next step after you self-assess and you’re ready to cultivate new friendships? 
  • [39:52] The things you shouldn’t do when you slide into someone’s DMs to make a connection. 
  • [42:04] When people tell you they aren’t available is not a sign that someone doesn’t like you. 
  • [44:49] If you’re willing to be a friend and put in the time, then it’s never too late. 
  • [45:19] Connect with Danielle. 

Links & Resources: 

Connect with Danielle: 

  • Friend Forward Podcast
  • Better Female Friendships
  • @friendforward on Instagram
  • @thefriendshipexpert on TikTok

RESOURCES MENTIONED

  • Join our weekly text inspiration list by texting PODCAST to 832-219-7815
  • Get our free download - The 5 Step Roadmap to Heal Love Addiction
  • Apply to work together in From Avoidant to Available
  • Learn that YOU ARE WORTHY  - Enroll in You Are Worthy here
  • Create balance and love in your life with The Loved Woman Planner

CONNECT WITH US ELSEWHERE

  • Instagram: @BlackGirlsHeal
  • Facebook: Black Girls Heal

  • [01:01] Welcome friendship coach and expert Danielle Bayard Jackson to chat all about making and maintaining adult female friendships.
  • [04:22] Listen as Danielle shares more about her background and business. 
  • [05:24] How did she become a friendship coach? 
  • [07:10] Why is it so difficult for us to keep and maintain female friendships in adulthood. 
  • [09:14] Danielle shares how she defines and describes a healthy friendship. 
  • [13:31] Ways to deal with the waiting period between finding new acquaintances and making new friends. 
  • [15:43] There is a study that has attempted to quantify how long it takes to build a friendship.
  • [18:03] What to do when you realize that you don’t feel like you have the energy for friendships. 
  • [23:42] Is there a right and wrong to determine how many coins we have available to give?
  • [27:03] The special thing about woman-to-woman friendships. 
  • [30:47] Learn the single greatest determining factor of our overall well-being. 
  • [32:37] What is your next step after you self-assess and you’re ready to cultivate new friendships? 
  • [39:52] The things you shouldn’t do when you slide into someone’s DMs to make a connection. 
  • [42:04] When people tell you they aren’t available is not a sign that someone doesn’t like you. 
  • [44:49] If you’re willing to be a friend and put in the time, then it’s never too late. 
  • [45:19] Connect with Danielle. 

Links & Resources: 

Connect with Danielle: 

  • Friend Forward Podcast
  • Better Female Friendships
  • @friendforward on Instagram
  • @thefriendshipexpert on TikTok

item.itunes:title: #107: Things I Learned During my Hiatus (Adult ADHD, Connecting, Feminine Energy, & More)
item.title: #107: Things I Learned During my Hiatus (Adult ADHD, Connecting, Feminine Energy, & More)
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: I’m back! It’s been a little over a month since I dropped a podcast episode and I've taken the time to do some deep soul searching. Listen in to hear all the things I’ve learned about myself both professionally and personally and what that means...
item.itunes:summary:
I’m back! It’s been a little over a month since I dropped a podcast episode and I've taken the time to do some deep soul searching. Listen in to hear all the things I’ve learned about myself both professionally and personally and what that means for you and the future of Black Girls Heal.

Probably the most important part of my hiatus was self-assessing my ADHD. I’ve spent years wondering whether or not I have ADHD. Every time I hear someone talk about the symptoms or describe their lives, I immediately think that they’re talking about my life. 

So, when one of my business mentors released a podcast episode describing their journey with ADHD, I decided it was time. I took several self-assessments and they all told the story of my ADHD. I then made an appointment with a psychiatrist to formalize my diagnosis and to be prescribed medication. 

My doctor agreed that I do indeed have ADHD, specifically inattentive ADHD, but unfortunately I cannot take any medication at this time. Now I’m looking for ways to treat this in a naturopathic way, but my goal is to elevate my overall health so that I can, someday soon, be placed on medications to help me with my activities of daily living. 

But that’s not all. This hiatus was a necessity for my life and business. Listen in to hear all about my revelations and what I focused on during the hiatus. I’m feeling better than ever and I cannot wait to get back into the swing of things and help women, specifically Black women, to heal. 

 

In this episode: 

[00:34] Welcome back to the Black Girls Heal podcast!

[02:15] I took this time to go through the Recovery School curriculum. 

[03:26] It was also a time to self-assess for ADHD and get clear on what I’m manifesting.

[05:08] Self-care was a huge focus for me during the hiatus as was personal development. 

[06:08] I sought clarity around how I help women publicly and privately. 

[07:57] I’ve suspected for several years that I qualified for the inattention version of ADHD, so I decided it was time to dig deeper. 

[11:52] How I approached my self-assessment and treatment. 

[14:09] The things I checked off as it applies to inattentive ADHD. 

[18:57] After all this work, I’m not able to take ADHD medication. 

[23:04] Why I want to be able to take medication in addition to natural therapies. 

[26:54] I do not want to see black people continue to struggle with their mental health when they need more than therapy, yoga, or prayer. 

[29:00] Stepping into my feminine energy has helped heal broken areas of my life. 

[32:00] I’m planning to head out to New York because travel is great for my soul, especially because my trips allow me to connect with students. 

[34:30] I’ve started dropping my excuses around exercise as self-care. 

[36:55] Be careful about the things that you say you’ll never participate in. 

[38:15] The last few things I focused on during the hiatus revolved around the business. 

[40:26] I’ve been wanting to start a YouTube channel for a long time, and I’m ready to do it, but in a different format. 

[42:30] I am launching a planner. Listen to learn what this planner is built to do for women everywhere. 

[44:42] I’m revealing the name of the new business and who this planner is for. 

[46:32] How I used the hiatus to confront and overcome my own impostor syndrome. 

[48:17] Stay tuned for all of these updates.

 

RESOURCES MENTIONED

  • Join our weekly text inspiration list by texting PODCAST to 832-219-7815
  • Get our free download - The 5 Step Roadmap to Heal Love Addiction
  • Apply to work together in From Avoidant to Available
  • Learn that YOU ARE WORTHY  - Enroll in You Are Worthy here
  • Create balance and love in your life with The Loved Woman Planner

Facebook: Black Girls Heal
Website: Blackgirlsheal.org

item.itunes:title: #106: When They Break Up With You Because You ‘Deserve Better’
item.title: #106: When They Break Up With You Because You ‘Deserve Better’
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: Something I see a lot with the women that I serve is this stressful and conflicting scenario of hearing the phrase “you deserve someone better”. This is a phrase that is commonly used when someone, particularly a romantic partner, seeks to cut...
item.itunes:summary:
Something I see a lot with the women that I serve is this stressful and conflicting scenario of hearing the phrase “you deserve someone better”. This is a phrase that is commonly used when someone, particularly a romantic partner, seeks to cut ties with us. 

 

In today’s episode, I’m sharing helpful and encouraging advice about finding the message within that particular message. I share 3 messages that you should know when you hear phrases such as “you deserve someone better,” or “it’s not you, it’s me”. I discuss why accepting this phrase stems from a low sense of self-worth, and a one-sided negotiation that only happens within yourself.

 

It can be easy to personalize and internalize this message. And my hopes with today’s episode is that I provide a new perspective to this roller coaster of a scenario. This is a common situation many of us find ourselves in at one point or another. So listen to this episode as many times as you need, share it with a friend or family member, and take the messages that resonate with you.

 

RESOURCES MENTIONED

  • The Healed and Loved Woman Membership
  • Join our weekly text inspiration list by texting PODCAST to 832-219-7815
  • Get our free download - The 5 Step Roadmap to Heal Love Addiction
  • Apply to work together in the Recovery School  - Click here to pre-apply!

item.itunes:title: #104: The 12-Step Experience for Sex and Love Addicts
item.title: #104: The 12-Step Experience for Sex and Love Addicts
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: Personally speaking, my experience with the 12-step philosophy for sex and love addicts was so healing and helpful. You might not be aware, but there are sex and love addicts anonymous programs that provide great transformation and inspiration when...
item.itunes:summary:
Personally speaking, my experience with the 12-step philosophy for sex and love addicts was so healing and helpful. You might not be aware, but there are sex and love addicts anonymous programs that provide great transformation and inspiration when done well.

 

In today’s episode, I’m sharing my experience and my story going through the 12-step method for sex and love addicts. I share the transformations I experienced and the inspirations I’ve walked away with, allowing me to infuse a lot of the teachings and filling the gaps that needed to be filled in my work.

 

I hope this episode will give you more insight into my experience with sex and love addicts anonymous. Listen to my story and hear what you can expect if you’re looking to get invested in this yourself.

 

 

RESOURCES MENTIONED

  • The Healed and Loved Woman Membership

item.itunes:title: #103: How to Know When You Are Done with Your Healing Process
item.title: #103: How to Know When You Are Done with Your Healing Process
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: One of the most common questions I get from my clients as we start working together is “how do I know when this is all going to be over?” The truth is many of my clients are dealing with terrible, horrific, and painful stuff that they don’t want...
item.itunes:summary:
One of the most common questions I get from my clients as we start working together is “how do I know when this is all going to be over?” The truth is many of my clients are dealing with terrible, horrific, and painful stuff that they don’t want to deal with anymore.

 

In today’s episode, I share the answer that I’ll give to you if you find yourself asking the same question. It’s not the prettiest answer, but it’s the best answer I have for you. I also share some smaller ways of noticing the real impact happening in your life.

 

Healing is not black and white, and the idea of never having any issues or disappointments  in your relationships, bank account, and other aspects of your life is unrealistic. It is my hope that the 3 different steps I share with you will help you notice just how far you’ve come and are continuing to go with your healing process. 

 

RESOURCES MENTIONED

  • The Healed and Loved Woman Membership
  • Join our weekly text inspiration list by texting PODCAST to 832-219-7815
  • Get our free download - The 5 Step Roadmap to Heal Love Addiction

item.itunes:title: #102: 3 Mistakes Made as a Love Avoidant in Marriage
item.title: #102: 3 Mistakes Made as a Love Avoidant in Marriage
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: This week, we’re finishing up our series on mistakes that I’ve made in my intimacy disorders and my relationship history. In this episode, I’m sharing the 3 mistakes that I’ve made as a love avoidant in my committed partnerships, including my...
item.itunes:summary:
This week, we’re finishing up our series on mistakes that I’ve made in my intimacy disorders and my relationship history. In this episode, I’m sharing the 3 mistakes that I’ve made as a love avoidant in my committed partnerships, including my marriage.

 

Love avoidance is the persistent act of putting up walls with loved ones, as if we were holding up an invisible shield. Some of us loudly declare our love avoidance by announcing that we have a hard time trusting people. Some of us might hide our voices well, but no one really gets to know the real us.

 

Although I’ve been more of a love addict in my past, where I overcompensated and made myself more emotionally available, what ended up happening was I fueled my love addictive behaviors. From learning how to access my feelings to involving my partner into my every day life, this episode will uncover my mistakes in an attempt to help others identify the core lack of skills of knowing how to be truly intimate with people and partners.

 

Get $50 off our You Are Worthy course by entering the coupon code MAY2021

item.itunes:title: #101: 3 Mistakes Made as a Love Addict in Marriage
item.title: #101: 3 Mistakes Made as a Love Addict in Marriage
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: So many of the teachings that I share on this podcast are targeted situations for single women. This week, I’m talking about how intimacy disorders, particularly love addiction, show up in committed relationships. This episode will define...
item.itunes:summary:
So many of the teachings that I share on this podcast are targeted situations for single women. This week, I’m talking about how intimacy disorders, particularly love addiction, show up in committed relationships.

 

This episode will define what being a love addict means as I share how my love addiction shows up in the forms of seeking constant verbal affirmation, making myself available to becoming who my committed partners wanted me to be, and my over-commitment to “fixing it,” even if they were red flags.

 

These 3 mistakes that I’ve made as a love addict come from my personal experience, strength, and understanding. And I’m sharing them in the hopes of helping others find resilience, community, and comradery with those who share the same experience.

 

Get $50 off our You Are Worthy course by entering the coupon code MAY2021

item.itunes:title: #100: 3 Mistakes I Made Dating as a Love Avoidant
item.title: #100: 3 Mistakes I Made Dating as a Love Avoidant
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: When I was dating, I made a lot of mistakes related to how I presented in my intimacy disorders. This week, I'm talking about how my love avoidance showed up for me in my relationships. For me, my personal experience and how that connected to my...
item.itunes:summary:
When I was dating, I made a lot of mistakes related to how I presented in my intimacy disorders. This week, I'm talking about how my love avoidance showed up for me in my relationships. 

For me, my personal experience and how that connected to my religious education really amplified a lot of my avoidance which is also discussed. 

This episode will not span all of the ways love avoidance can show up in relationships as that as been discussed in previous episodes. But we hope these real experiences will help validate and give solace to the women who need to hear these stories represented.

item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: In this episode, we're going to talk about trauma and how it shows up in men, impacts their self worth and their relationships. The episode is created for men to find connection but also for the women who love them who hear and understand their...
item.itunes:summary:
In this episode, we're going to talk about trauma and how it shows up in men, impacts their self worth and their relationships. 

The episode is created for men to find connection but also for the women who love them who hear and understand their experience as well. We hope this helps continue the healing conversations between the us.

 

Men, take my feedback survey at HealingtheChampion.com

item.itunes:title: #93: Healing Your Mother Wound
item.title: #93: Healing Your Mother Wound
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: Our mother relationship is our first relationship as we come into this world. As a result, if we have unresolved trauma, it will manifest in how we see ourselves, how we see others, and what we pass down to future generations. We talk about it today,...
item.itunes:summary:
Our mother relationship is our first relationship as we come into this world. As a result, if we have unresolved trauma, it will manifest in how we see ourselves, how we see others, and what we pass down to future generations. We talk about it today, where it comes from, and what to do with it, with our special guest, Jennifer Arnise. 

CONNECT WITH OUR GUEST

Website: BlackMotherWound.com

Instagram: @blackmotherwound

item.itunes:title: #86: Connecting to Black Women After Being Rejected for Not Being Black Enough
item.title: #86: Connecting to Black Women After Being Rejected for Not Being Black Enough
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: If you grew up in a mostly white or non-black setting and experienced peer trauma for "not being Black enough," sometimes it shows up as fear of rejection from other black women as an adult. In this episode, we talk about that, some items to keep in...
item.itunes:summary:
If you grew up in a mostly white or non-black setting and experienced peer trauma for "not being Black enough," sometimes it shows up as fear of rejection from other black women as an adult. In this episode, we talk about that, some items to keep in mind, and steps to take to heal and work through that.

item.itunes:title: #70: What if I Can't Get Better [Student Highlight]
item.title: #70: What if I Can't Get Better [Student Highlight]
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: You're doing your healing process (or you're thinking about starting) and you have this fear about what if I can't get better? What if this is all I will ever be? What if I try to change but don't actually improve? This can make you feel defeated...
item.itunes:summary:
You're doing your healing process (or you're thinking about starting) and you have this fear about what if I can't get better? What if this is all I will ever be? What if I try to change but don't actually improve?

This can make you feel defeated before you even start. In this episode, we're going to talk about what those pauses mean and how they are actually proof of your improvement.

item.itunes:title: #59: Why They're Treating You the Way They're Treating You
item.title: #59: Why They're Treating You the Way They're Treating You
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: You were so in love, but things have changed. Y'all were best friends, but now it feels like she betrayed you. And while things change in relationships all of this time, this was one where you didn't expect it to be this way. It's totally...
item.itunes:summary:
You were so in love, but things have changed. 

Y'all were best friends, but now it feels like she betrayed you. 

And while things change in relationships all of this time, this was one where you didn't expect it to be this way. It's totally blind-sided you. 

In this episode, we're going to talk about why they're treating you the way they're treating you.

item.description:
Sometimes we deal with feeling empty and unsatisfied. Sometimes we don't even realize it! In this week's episode, we dive into exactly what feeling unsatisfied looks like and haw to heal from it. We speak with a current student of the Black Girls Heal Recovery School program and hear how this feeling presented its self in her life. 

MENTIONED IN THIS EPISODE

Register for the Self Love Intensive: blackgirlsheal.org/self-love

Recovery School Waitlist: therecoveryschool.com/waitlist

item.itunes:summary:
In the words of Cardi B, "[Things] are getting real." Some of us are going to have a lot more time with ourselves and some of us are going to be tempted to go to unhealthy coping mechanisms. 

This episode will focus on showing up as your best self and not using relationships to cope with triggers.

item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: Ever wonder what that deep, painful feeling is that happens after you break up as a love addict? Ever feel that it hits you differently than others and you wonder why? Well, you're not imagining it. It's called withdrawal, and you can get...
item.itunes:summary:
Ever wonder what that deep, painful feeling is that happens after you break up as a love addict? Ever feel that it hits you differently than others and you wonder why?

 

Well, you're not imagining it. It's called withdrawal, and you can get through it.

 

Take a listen and learn more about what it is, why it happens, and next steps you can take to recover.

item.content:encoded:
Ever wonder what that deep, painful feeling is that happens after you break up as a love addict? Ever feel that it hits you differently than others and you wonder why?

 

Well, you're not imagining it. It's called withdrawal, and you can get through it.

 

Take a listen and learn more about what it is, why it happens, and next steps you can take to recover. 

 

Take Our Free Masterclass:
How to Stop Continually Finding and Dating the Wrong People: The 6 Step Method to Stop Attracting (and Obsessing About) Situationships to Get the Relationships You Want

item.itunes:title: #13: Identifying Your Feelings (With an Intimacy Disorder)
item.title: #13: Identifying Your Feelings (With an Intimacy Disorder)
item.itunes:author: Shena Lashey
item.itunes:subtitle: Determining how we feel is vital to showing up for ourselves with self-love, showing up as our own person in relationships, and getting what we need. But it can be hard to get in touch with our feelings if we have spent years suppressing them or...
item.itunes:summary:
Determining how we feel is vital to showing up for ourselves with self-love, showing up as our own person in relationships, and getting what we need. But it can be hard to get in touch with our feelings if we have spent years suppressing them or self-medicating. 

In this episode, I talk about how it may look like to shut down your feelings with an intimacy disorder and how to start the process of feeling your emotions again or for the first time. 


MENTIONED IN THIS EPISODE:

The Iceberg Video

"Going on a Bear Hunt" Children's Song

item.itunes:subtitle: Letting others in is hard. We can be afraid of being hurt, let down, or made to look foolish. It's also hard to determine who are the right people to let in, if any at all. In this episode, we dig into what gets in the way of letting others in, how...
item.itunes:summary:
Letting others in is hard. We can be afraid of being hurt, let down, or made to look foolish. It's also hard to determine who are the right people to let in, if any at all.


In this episode, we dig into what gets in the way of letting others in, how we may be the main ones who stop it, and next steps we can take to get better. 

Take Our Free Masterclass:
How to Fix Your Internal Magnet: The 6 Step Method to Stop Attracting and Obsessing About Unavailable Partners to Get the Love You Deserve

-- Register now

GET STARTED CHANGING YOUR RELATIONSHIPS
Join the Learn to THRIVE group coaching program and course by going to LearntoThriveCourse.com
